member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent
member.summary: This class represents the input event from Amazon Lex. It used as the input parameter for Lambda functions. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/lex/latest/dg/lambda-input-response-format.html

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.MessageVersion
member.summary: The version of the message that identifies the format of the event data going into the Lambda function and the expected format of the response from a Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.InvocationSource
member.summary: To indicate why Amazon Lex is invoking the Lambda function

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.UserId
member.summary: This value is provided by the client application. Amazon Lex passes it to the Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.SessionAttributes
member.summary: Application-specific session attributes that the client sent in the request. If you want Amazon Lex to include them in the response to the client, your Lambda function should send these back to Amazon Lex in response.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.Bot
member.summary: The Lex bot invoking the Lambda function

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.OutputDialogMode
member.summary:
For each user input, the client sends the request to Amazon Lex using one of the runtime API operations, PostContent or PostText. From the API request parameters, Amazon Lex determines whether the response to the client (user) is text or voice, and sets this field accordingly.
The Lambda function can use this information to generate an appropriate message. For example, if the client expects a voice response, your Lambda function could return Speech Synthesis Markup LanguageSpeech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML) instead of text.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.CurrentIntent
member.summary: Provides the intent name, slots, and confirmationStatus fields.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexCurrentIntent
member.summary: The class representing the current intent for the Lambda function to process.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexCurrentIntent.Name
member.summary: The intent's name

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexCurrentIntent.Slots
member.summary: List of slots that are configured for the intent and values that are recognized by Amazon Lex in the user conversation from the beginning. Otherwise, the values are null.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexCurrentIntent.ConfirmationStatus
member.summary: The ConfirmationStatus provides the user response to a confirmation prompt, if there is one.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexCurrentIntent.InputTranscript
member.summary: The text used to process the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexBot
member.summary: The class identifies the Lex bot that is invoking the Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexBot.Name
member.summary: The name of the Lex bot

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexBot.Alias
member.summary: The alias of the Lex bot

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexEvent.LexBot.Version
member.summary: The version of the Lex bot

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse
member.summary: This class is used as the return for AWS Lambda functions that are invoked by Lex to handle Bot interactions. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/lex/latest/dg/lambda-input-response-format.html

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.SessionAttributes
member.summary: Application-specific session attributes. This is an optional field.

members.member: This is the only field that is required. The value of DialogAction.Type directs Amazon Lex to the next course of action, and describes what to expect from the user after Amazon Lex returns a response to the client. \

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction
member.summary: The class representing the dialog action.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.Type
member.summary: The type of action for Lex to take with the response from the Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.FulfillmentState
member.summary: The state of the fullfillment. "Fulfilled" or "Failed"

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.Message
member.summary: The message to be sent to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.IntentName
member.summary: The intent name you want to confirm or elicit.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.Slots
member.summary: The values for all of the slots when response is of type "Delegate".

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.SlotToElicit
member.summary: The slot to elicit when the Type is "ElicitSlot"

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexDialogAction.ResponseCard
member.summary: The response card provides information back to the bot to display for the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexMessage
member.summary: The class represents the message that the bot will use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexMessage.ContentType
member.summary: The content type of the message. PlainText or SSML

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexMessage.Content
member.summary: The message to be asked to the user by the bot.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexResponseCard
member.summary: The class representing the response card sent back to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexResponseCard.Version
member.summary: The version of the response card.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexResponseCard.ContentType
member.summary: The content type of the response card. The default is "application/vnd.amazonaws.card.generic".

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexResponseCard.GenericAttachments
member.summary: The list of attachments sent back with the response card.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexGenericAttachments
member.summary: The class representing generic attachments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexGenericAttachments.Title
member.summary: The card's title.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexGenericAttachments.SubTitle
member.summary: The card's sub title.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexGenericAttachments.ImageUrl
member.summary: URL to an image to be shown.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexGenericAttachments.AttachmentLinkUrl
member.summary: URL of the attachment to be associated with the card.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexGenericAttachments.Buttons
member.summary: The list of buttons to be displayed with the response card.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexButton
member.summary: The class representing a button in the response card.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexButton.Text
member.summary: The text for the button.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.LexEvents.LexResponse.LexButton.Value
member.summary: The value of the button sent back to the server.
